main event: One object was observed in Dothan, Alabama on December 9, 1957, described as a light with various colors.
interesting points: The object was a bright red light that faded to pink and white; It was seen from an aircraft flying at 8,000 feet; The sighting lasted approximately 7 minutes; The object was determined to probably be an aircraft light; A helicopter was reported to be in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
witness description: Major Norman W. Goodwin, Captain George E. Thayer, both from the United States Army Aviation School
